title: Nigeria revels in removal from list of polio-endemic nations
text:
Lagos - Nigeria on Saturday celebrated the announcement by the UN health agency that polio is no longer endemic in the country. Polio which can cause life-long paralysis can be prevented with a simple vaccination.
Polio is no longer endemic in Nigeria, the World Health Organisation said late on Friday, leaving only Pakistan and its war-battered neighbour Afghanistan in the list of countries where the disease is prevalent.
"It's a great moment for Nigeria," Dr. Tunji Funsho, chairman of the Rotary International's Polio Campaign in Nigeria, told The Associated Press. "We should celebrate but with a caveat that we should not let our guard down." He attributed the success to teamwork between government and non-governmental health organisations.
Stigmas falling away
